author: National Bureau
text:
The All-India Congress Committee (AICC) disciplinary committee headed by the former Defence Minister, A.K. Antony, accepted Mumbai Congress chief Sanjay Nirupam’s apology over the publication of controversial articles criticising the former Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, and terming party president Sonia Gandhi’s father a “fascist soldier” and asking him “to be careful in the future.”

“Sanjay Nirupam accepted the responsibility for publication of grossly inaccurate, baseless and malicious article against the Congress leadership in the party magazine, Congress Darshan and submitted his unconditional apology for the same,” sources said.

“The Central Disciplinary Action Committee cautioned him to be careful in the future while editing, printing and publishing materials in the magazine so that this type of grave mistake is not repeated,” sources in the party said.
title: AICC accepts Nirupam’s apology
